info.name: " Libris " Library Management System – API Documentation
info.description: This document outlines all essential API endpoints of the Libris project, including authentication, book operations, borrowing/returning workflows, user statistics, and reactive (WebFlux) capabilities.

item.name: Auth

request.description: Authenticate a user using email and password. On success, returns a JWT token used to authorize secured requests across the API.

response.name: Login - Success

item.description: Handles user authentication and JWT token generation.

item.name: User

request.description: Registers a new user (PATRON or LIBRARIAN) by providing their personal details.

response.name: create user
response.body:

    "id": "1469809b-5ced-41b5-9cf0-f02fd8a14320",

}

request.description: Updates an existing user's information. Only accessible by authorized roles.

response.name: Update No Change

request.description: Performs a soft delete on a user. The record remains in the database but is marked as deleted.

response.name: Delete - Not Found ID

request.description: Fetches user details by ID. Returns basic user profile information including role and current stats.

item.description: Manage users in the Libris system, including registration and profile-related operations.

item.name: Book

request.description: Adds a new book to the library collection with required fields such as title, author, ISBN, genre, and page count.
Retrieves a list of all books or performs a filtered search based on title, author, or ISBN. Supports pagination.

request.description: Marks a book as deleted (soft delete). It will no longer appear in public listings but remains in the system for audit purposes.

response.name: Delete Book - Not Found

request.description: Updates information about a specific book. Only LIBRARIAN or MANAGER roles can perform this operation.

item.description: Manages all book-related operations including create, update, delete, and search.

item.name: Borrow

request.description: Marks a borrowed book as returned using its borrow ID. Updates return date and user score automatically.

response.name: Return Book
response.body:
{
    "id": "b755dfba-40bb-4b9d-bf81-4ab4cf67ca72",
    "bookTitle": "Animal Farm",
    "userFullName": "George Harris",
    "borrowDate": "2025-05-12",
    "dueDate": "2025-05-14",
    "returnDate": "2025-05-13",
    "returned": true,
    "createdAt": "2025-05-13T00:05:44.386044",
    "updatedAt": "2025-05-13T00:05:44.386044"
}

request.description: Performs a reactive search for books using a keyword that can match the title, author name, or ISBN. Results are streamed and support pagination via query, page, and size parameters

item.description: Provides real-time, non-blocking endpoints using Spring WebFlux. Designed for modern client applications requiring live updates and reactive search capabilities.
